snippet.title: Journalists charged over human trafficking report are released on bail
snippet.description:
* Two journalists in Thailand have been released on bail in a controversial defamation case that has raised concerns over press freedom in the country.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/18/world/asia/thailand-phuketwan-bail/index.html

snippet.title: Gabriel Garcia Marquez, Nobel Prize-winning author, dies at 87
snippet.description:
* Gabriel García Márquez, the influential, Nobel Prize-winning author of "One Hundred Years of Solitude" and "Love in the Time of Cholera," has died, his family and officials said.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/17/world/americas/gabriel-garcia-marquez-dies/index.html

snippet.title: It's a mad, mad, mad, 'Mad Men' world
snippet.description:
* A funny thing happened to "Mad Men" on its way to its seventh season.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/11/showbiz/tv/mad-men-season-7-preview-impact/index.html

snippet.title: Bloomberg editor resigns over handling of China story
snippet.description:
* A senior Bloomberg News journalist quit his role earlier this month, saying the "mishandling" by his bosses of a story critical of China was behind his departure, amid suggestions that the New York-based company is pushing a financial strategy for China that overshadows editorial autonomy.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/03/28/world/asia/china-bloomberg-editor-resigns/index.html

snippet.title: Unexplored angles of the missing plane
snippet.description:
* Today on CNN’s Reliable Sources hosted by Brian Stelter, media reporter at the Washington Post, Erik Wemple, spoke to Stelter about the wall-to-wall coverage on cable this week about Malaysia Flight 370. Jahabar Sidiq, CEO and editor of The Malaysian...
http://cnnpressroom.blogs.cnn.com/2014/03/23/unexplored-angles-of-the-missing-plane/

snippet.title: 'Network': The angriest movie of all time
Is this Brad Pitt's next role?
snippet.description:
* For movie inspiration, Brad Pitt is looking no further than his bookshelf. The actor/producer, who just won an Oscar with 2013's adaptation of Solomon Northup's slave narrative, "12 Years A Slave," is now working on an adaptation of late journalist...
http://marquee.blogs.cnn.com/2014/04/15/is-this-brad-pitts-next-role/

snippet.title: Pakistani military pushes to block network of Hamid Mir, anchor shot by attackers
snippet.description:
* Pakistan's military is pushing to black out a national news station, calling its citing of a man tying government agents to the attempted assassination of his brother -- a prominent TV news anchor -- "false, malicious and irresponsible reporting."
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/23/world/asia/pakistan-tv-network-targeted/index.html

snippet.title: Gunmen target prominent Pakistani news anchor Hamid Mir
snippet.description:
* Gunmen wounded a prominent Pakistani TV news anchor on Saturday in an attack his brother linked to the nation's government, despite its firm denial.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/19/world/asia/pakistan-journalist-attacked/index.html

snippet.title: Aaron Sorkin apologizes for 'The Newsroom'
snippet.description:
* Fan of "The Newsroom"? Aaron Sorkin owes you an apology - and that's coming from the creator himself. According to BuzzFeed, the "Newsroom" creator told an audience gathered to hear his talk with Jon Favreau at the Tribeca Film Festival Monday that...
http://marquee.blogs.cnn.com/2014/04/23/178825/
